settings.fullinfotext:
Adorned with jewelry from head to toe, an Indian bride truly embodies the epitome of elegance. Gracefully carrying those beautiful pieces of jewelry, symbolizing culture and tradition, the bride exudes a regal aura. Among these exquisite bridal jewelry pieces, necklaces never fail to grab attention. Necklaces hold a significant place elevating the bridal look in an instant. Styling these is a delicate art and what could be better than being guided through this by a professional bridal stylist with some tips to style a neck-hugging necklace that has been a symbol of fashion and tradition for centuries?

You guessed it right! We will be sharing insights from bridal stylists on how to embrace the charm of an Indian wedding choker necklace on your big day to create a mesmerizing bridal ensemble that leaves a lasting impression.

settings.headingtext: But What Exactly is a Choker Necklace?

settings.fullinfotext:
Often associated with contemporary fashion, the choker is a piece of history. Famous for its timeless look and blending nature, the choker has survived the test of time for centuries. The oldest appearance of the choker necklace dates back to 2500 DC. However, it's said that it got its tag as a fashion accessory in the 19th century.

Chokers rest snugly around the neck, they are worn high on the neck. They are sleek, chic, and generally tight-fitting, accentuating the collarbone and adding a touch of elegance and sophistication to any outfit. From their humble origins as beadwork to their transformation into elegant metals, chokers have undeniably cemented their esteemed position in the world of jewelry.

settings.headingtext: The Rich Heritage of Indian Wedding Chokers

settings.smallinfotext: Image courtesy: Museum of Art and Photography

settings.fullinfotext: Choker, believed to have originated in ancient Egypt, continues to captivate women worldwide, becoming a timeless symbol of admiration and allure. The welcoming nature and diversity of Indian culture are often reflected in Indian jewelry. Traveling for centuries, and crossing countries, today choker has become an indispensable part of Indian bridal jewelry. But with its own unique touch of course.

settings.smallinfotext: Image courtesy: Museum of Art and Photography

settings.fullinfotext:
Today’s Indian choker is a seamless amalgamation of trends and the age-old craft of jewelry making. Crafted with meticulous attention to detail, Indian chokers boast intricate designs and are often embellished with precious gemstones like diamonds, rubies, emeralds, and pearls.

Each region in India has its unique take on choker designs, showcasing diverse and rich craftsmanship across the country. For instance, the Kundan chokers from Rajasthan are renowned for their intricate setting of gemstones, while the Polki chokers celebrate the art of uncut diamond jewelry. While Meenakari chokers from Gujarat exhibit vibrant enamel work, gold marvels from South India showcase intricate temple-inspired designs.

Taking inspiration from many century-old jewelry-making styles and seamlessly blending traditional designs with contemporary elements, Indian chokers have stood the test of time, despite the continuously changing bridal jewelry trends. There are many variations of chokers in Indian bridal jewelry and here is how bridal stylists guide on styling these collar crowns!

There are various types of chokers available in the world of Indian bridal jewelry and each of them boasts their own unique beauty and craftsmanship. Styling them in the right way can help you land a perfect bridal look. A bridal stylist understands the significance of the right bridal jewelry and can help you create a look that not only leaves a lasting impression but also effortlessly accentuates your features.

With their consultations, bridal stylists gain in-depth knowledge about your preferences and use it to create a look that not only radiates you but also resonates with you on a deeper level. Bridal stylists help you choose the right Indian bridal choker for your big day.

From the exquisite types of Indian bridal chokers, the mesmerizing Kundan chokers stand out. They feature a transparent stone set on metal with a gold foil placed in the middle. Radiating a regal splendor that perfectly complements the traditional bridal ensembles. Their timeless elegance and intricate design make them a popular choice. Bridal stylists can suggest going for a Kundan choker if you want to exude sophistication and grace on the big day.

If you are seeking a touch of vintage glamor, bridal stylists would suggest a magnificent option - Polki Choker. Adorned with raw and uncut diamonds, these chokers capture the essence of old-world charm, adding a touch of grandeur and opulence to the bridal attire. Their dazzling brilliance and captivating brilliance land a classic and timeless look.

Talking about Indian bridal jewelry and not mentioning Meenakari and Temple jewelry? Instantly infusing bridal ensembles with a splash of color, Meenakari chokers are a true embodiment of artistic finesse and traditional craftsmanship. If you want to showcase your vivacious spirit and add a unique twist to your wedding attire, the bridal stylist’s top pick will be the Meenakari choker. Embellished with colorful enamel work on metal, they bring vibrancy and a joyful vibe to the table.

Inspired by intricate temple carvings, temple jewelry chokers have a different appeal. Exuding a sense of sacred beauty, with their ethereal aura and delicate detailing, they will be a top choice of bridal stylists for landing enchanting and graceful bridal looks.

settings.smallinfotext: Navya Navaratna Choker Necklace by Aurus

settings.fullinfotext:
One of the essential aspects of styling chokers for the big day is pairing them with the right neckline. Different choker styles harmonize with various neckline designs, allowing you to showcase the choker in the most flattering manner. A bridal stylist understands the significance of pairing the right bridal jewelry with your outfit considering its neckline and they will help you choose the best one. For instance, a sweetheart neckline pairs exquisitely with a delicate and narrow choker with a tiny drop, accentuating the collarbones and adding a touch of sophistication to the bridal look.

For scoop necklines, bridal stylists can suggest a broader and more intricate choker that fills the space elegantly, creating a balanced and striking appearance. V-neck and off-the-shoulder necklines can be complemented with a choker that follows the neckline's shape, accentuating the neck and shoulders gracefully.

Layering chokers with other necklaces has become a contemporary trend, opening a door to express individuality and creativity, and like any other bridal jewelry trend, bridal stylists are well versed with this one as well. They understand that the key to successfully layering chokers and necklaces lies in striking the right balance between different lengths and styles.

Drawing attention to the neck and necklaces, bridal stylists can suggest pairing a delicate choker with a longer necklace like Satlada Haar or Mango Mala to create a cascading effect. For a more cluttered look, they can also suggest adding delicate chains longer than the other necklace.

Bridal stylists know that mixing and matching chokers of varying designs and textures can add depth and dimension to the bridal look while maintaining an aura of elegance. Without overpowering each other, bridal stylists guide you on how to combine different pieces harmoniously. For example, if you are wearing a heavy Kundan necklace, they can guide you to pair it with a dainty single-line Meenakari choker.

Though necklaces take center stage, the bridal look is incomplete without other pieces of jewelry like earrings, nose rings, mang tikka etc. Bridal stylists understand that it is essential to strike a harmonious balance with other bridal jewelry pieces to create a cohesive and well-coordinated look so that they complement each other.

By selecting a maangtikka that echoes your choker's design elements to going for a nose ring that complements the choker's color scheme, bridal stylists create a look that is a seamless blend of all the bridal jewelry articles. They bring in a sense of harmony and take your bridal appearance to a different level.

By following the expert tips shared by bridal stylists, you can confidently embrace the grandeur of chokers and create a mesmerizing bridal look that will be etched in memories for years to come. With their understanding and creativity, bridal stylists help you choose a choker necklace that will not only elevate your look but also make you feel like royalty. They make sure that you have a cherished memory of your big day and leave a lasting impression on all those witnessing the magical moment of your life.
